name: Pact Drake
resist: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Binding Witness
text: Creatures that make a pact or agree to terms while the drake witnesses the agreement are bound by the drake's magic. They have disadvantage on saving throws against scrying by the drake (simply making a successful save against the drake's scrying usually is enough to arouse its suspicion), and they become potential targets for the drake's Punish Transgressor action.

trait.name: Sense Falsehood
text: The drake knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: Pact's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only somantic components:

action.name: Multiattack
text: The pact drake makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Claw
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Enforced Diplomacy (Recharge 5-6)
text: The pact drake breathes a calming haze in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the cone must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be charmed for 1 minute. While charmed, a creature also can't attack up to five creatures of the pact drake's choice. A charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

action.name: Punish Transgressor
text: The drake targets a single creature within 60 feet that broke the terms of a pact witnessed by the drake. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be blinded, deafened, and stunned for 1d6 minutes. The conditions can be ended early only with a dispel magic (DC 15) spell or similar magic. When these conditions end, the affected creature has disadvantage on saving throws until it finishes a long rest.

spells: detect magic, arcane eye, clairvoyance, scrying
